SEARCH
Package com.rikuthin.utility

Class ImageUtils

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.utility.ImageUtils
public class ImageUtils extends Object
The ImageUtils class provides a collection of static utility methods for the manipulation and processing of BufferedImage objects, such as copying and scaling.

This class does not handle image loading (I/O) or resource management.

  • Method Details

    • copyImage

      public static BufferedImage copyImage(BufferedImage source)
      Creates a deep copy of the given BufferedImage.

      This method is useful when an image needs to be modified (e.g., rotated or colored) without altering the original source image.

      Parameters:
      source - The source BufferedImage to copy. If null, returns null.
      Returns:
      A new, independent BufferedImage instance with the same content, or null if the source is null.

    • scaleBufferedImageSize

      public static BufferedImage scaleBufferedImageSize(BufferedImage originalImage, double scaleX, double scaleY)
      Creates a new BufferedImage that is a scaled version of the original, with the original image drawn onto it, scaled by the provided factor.

      The resulting dimensions (width and height) are rounded to the nearest integer.

      Parameters:
      originalImage - The BufferedImage to scale.
      scaleX - The factor by which to scale the image's width.
      scaleY - The factor by which to scale the image's height. Use absolute values.
      Returns:
      A new BufferedImage that is scaled by the provided factors, or null if the original image is null.

    • scaleBufferedImageSize

      public static BufferedImage scaleBufferedImageSize(BufferedImage originalImage, double scaleFactor)
      Creates a new BufferedImage that is a uniformly scaled version of the original, with the original image drawn onto it, scaled by the provided factor.

      The resulting dimensions (width and height) are rounded to the nearest integer.

      Parameters:
      originalImage - The BufferedImage to scale.
      scaleFactor - The factor by which to scale both the width and height. Use absolute value.
      Returns:
      A new BufferedImage that is scaled by the provided factor, or null if the original image is null.
